intro: Borreria flavescens, commonly known as yellow borreria, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
